channel.title: uml on Andy Dote
channel.description: Recent content in uml on Andy Dote

item.title: The reports of UML's death are greatly exaggerated
item.description: This is in response to the recent posts about the death of UML; while I think some parts of UML have fallen ill, the remaining parts are still alive, and useful to this day. TLDR Out of 14 types of diagram there are 3 that I use on a regular basis: Activity Diagram, State Machine Diagram, and Sequence Diagram. I think the Timing Diagram is borderline, but I can only think of a couple of occasions when it has been useful.
